intro: Okoubaka aubrevillei var. aubrevillei, commonly known as the African violet, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family, characterized by its attractive, velvety foliage and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with broad, waxy leaves and tubular, brightly colored flowers. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This variety is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
